origin_story.title: The $47,000 Mistake That Started It All
paragraphs: In 2022, our founder ran a successful home services company in Knoxville, Tennessee. Business was growing, the team was busy, and everything seemed great on paper. But there was a hidden problem bleeding money.

A routine audit revealed the truth: 47% of incoming calls were going unanswered. During peak hours, on weekends, and after 5 PM, potential customers were calling and getting voicemail. Most never called back. Conservative math showed we were leaving $47,000 in revenue on the table that year alone.

The typical solutions were not good enough. Hiring a full-time receptionist meant $40,000+ in salary for someone who could only work 40 hours a week. Answering services were expensive, impersonal, and still missed calls during high-volume periods. After trying every option on the market and being disappointed by each one, the decision was made: build something better.

That frustration became Capture Client. We combined enterprise-grade AI voice technology with years of small business marketing experience to create a solution that actually works for businesses like ours. Today, we serve 500+ companies across the country, and we have helped capture more than 50,000 leads that would have otherwise been lost to voicemail.

callout.title: The Industry Reality
callout.content: 67% of callers who reach voicemail will not leave a message. 85% of people whose calls go unanswered will not call back. They call your competitor instead.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.statement: Level the playing field for small businesses by giving them enterprise-grade technology without enterprise-grade costs.
mission.description: Small businesses are the backbone of America. They employ nearly half of all private-sector workers and create two-thirds of new jobs. But they are competing against giants with unlimited resources and 24/7 call centers. Our AI voice agents ensure that when a customer calls, they get answered professionally, whether it is 2 PM on Tuesday or 2 AM on Sunday.
